info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 01 at 8:49PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Mesa, western Garfield and northeastern Grand Counties through 915 PM MDT... At 849 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 27 miles west of Fruita, or 37 miles west of Grand Junction, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Mesa, western Garfield and northeastern Grand Counties. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 1 and 6. Interstate 70 in Utah between mile markers 218 and 231. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
